task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 47°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current view (pitch 0°) only shows the lower part of the target building, so I need to look up to see the full structure from ground to roof, which requires rotating the camera upward with a positive pitch delta.

The current heading is 0°N, which is not aligned with the target building's North-East (47°) direction, so I need to rotate right by 47 degrees to face the target, then I can adjust pitch to view the full structure.

Now that I'm facing the target building (47°NE), the current pitch 0° only shows the lower section; I need to look up to view the roof, so I'll rotate the camera upward with a pitch delta of 30° to capture the upper part of the structure.

Current heading is 0°N, which is misaligned with the target building's 47°NE direction; rotating right by 47 degrees will reorient me to face the target, allowing me to view its full structure for height estimation.

Now facing the target building at 47°NE with pitch 0°, I need to look up more than 30° to fully see the roof, so I'll rotate the camera upward to a pitch of 45° to capture the entire structure from ground to roof.

Current heading is 0°N, which is misaligned with the target building's 47°NE direction; rotating right by 47 degrees will reorient me to face the target, allowing me to view its full structure for height estimation.

Now facing the target building at 47°NE with pitch 0°, I need to look up to view the roof section, so I'll rotate the camera upward to a pitch of 30° while maintaining the correct heading to capture the upper part of the structure.

Current heading is 0°N, which is not aligned with the target building's 47°NE direction; rotating right by 47 degrees will reorient me to face the target, enabling me to view its full structure for height estimation.

I've been mistakenly using relative rotation values that reset my heading; now I'll use absolute rotation to keep heading 47°NE and set pitch to 30° up, allowing me to view the upper section of the target building while maintaining alignment.

Now that I can see the full target building from ground to roof, I estimate its height by counting approximately 8 residential floors (each averaging 3 meters), resulting in a total height of 24 meters.
